events.name: 4th SUTD-MIT IDC Summit
events.description:
Saturday & Sunday, 23 & 24 Jan
10am -7pm
ArtScience Galleries, L4
Free

ArtScience Museum will be hosting the 4th SUTD Singapore University of Technology & Design - MIT International Design Center Summit, held on 20 - 24 January 2016. The Summit will include a Sunday Showcase on 23 – 24 January 2016 which displays the prototypes and projects participants of the summit have been working on. Meet the makers on Sunday, 24 Jan and find out more about how design has changed the world .

events.name: EML Ableton Live Workshop 2016
events.description:
Hey guys!

We're glad to announce that we're gonna be having another round of workshops for YOU music lovers! Details of our ABLETON LIVE WORKSHOP can be found below:

Date: 23rd & 30th Jan 2016
Time: 1100 - 1600
Location: Practice Room L3, Stephen Riady Center, UTOWN
Cost: $50 (Includes T-Shirt)

During the Workshop, our established principal tutor, Benjamin Ang will be teaching you about the basics behind producing on Ableton Live, from choosing your instruments to adding that sweeping effect onto your song, starting you on your journey to composing your own original electronic music piece.

SIGN UP NOW: TINYURL.COM/EMLWORKSHOP2016
events.location: Practice Room L3, Stephen Riady Center, UTOWN

events.name: Hack&Roll 2016
events.description:
**Please make sure you sign up through the website below!**

http://hacknroll.nushackers.org/

By students, for students - NUS Hackers' annual, largest student-run hackathon in Singapore will be happening on the 23rd/24th of January next year.

Registration is absolutely free, and you're allowed to build ANYTHING you want. Students from all institutions (including primary, secondary, polytechnic and junior colleges) are welcome to attend! 

Sign up for entry here: http://hacknroll.nushackers.org/register.html

events.name: First 2016 meetup - FPV Racing: blow off the cobwebs, and spin those prop-nuts!
events.description: Weather permitting - we're still in rainy season with some wet afternoons, so make sure to check the forecast on the day and look out for comments on the event! We'll be setting up a race course, simple one for beginners and a more advanced one for those who like a challenge. We'll fly in pairs / threes with staggered starts and time trials, and hopefully get some sort of tournament leaderboard going. As we'll be racing, please be patient and work with the organisers to keep everything safe and on schedule, that means not flying until it's your turn, and being able to switch your transmitter frequency to an assigned channel. As always, the following rules apply: 1) Don't switch on your VTx without pre-announcing it to fliers currently in the air and waiting for their confirmation 2) Make sure you know your VTx frequency and are able to adjust it 3) During racing, if you're not currently racing do not switch on at all, until the current race is complete 4) Don't fly beyond your own abilities Read up on FPV etiquette! We're a friendly and encouraging group though, so even if you're a beginner we'll help you to get started. NB - This is a casual meetup and all attendees are responsible for their own safety and liability.
events.location: Behind Outram Park MRT, 1A Pearl Bank, Singapore
